intro: Psoralea plicata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces yellowish or pale green flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Psoralea plicata is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
